title: How to Send an Undisclosed Recipients Email

steps.headline: Open 'Contacts', and make a new entry.
steps.description: Write "Undisclosed" (not including the quotation marks) in the First Name line, and "Recipients" in the surname line.

steps.headline: If your email program requires that at least one email address be listed in the "to" field, write your own email address in that line.
steps.description: (Gmail does not require that.) Otherwise, leave it blank. (Unless there is a recipient of your email that you'd like everyone to see.)

steps.headline: In some email programs, you'll need to change "Display as" to read "Undisclosed Recipients.
steps.description: Write Undisclosed Recipients or select it when the box pops up.

steps.headline: Press 'Show Cc and Bcc' and type all the addresses of the people you would like to send an email to in the Bcc line.
steps.description: This stands for "blind carbon copy" and will send a copy of your email to every address listed, but will not display their email address to the other recipients.

steps.headline: Finish composing your email and press "send" when you're completed!
